str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Met: I am pierced, stung, smitten. From kata and nusso; to pierce thoroughly, i.e. to agitate violently.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Left, left behind, the remainder, the rest, the others. Masculine plural of a derivative of leipo; remaining ones.
From apostello; a delegate; specially, an ambassador of the Gospel; officially a commissioner of Christ.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
